name: 莎士比亞（一）
goals: To provide an introduction to the major plays of William Shakespeare
Students will encounter and enjoy in each semester four major plays of the author.
syllabus:
This course provides an introduction to the major plays of William Shakespeare. With this course, students will encounter and enjoy in each semester four major plays of the author.  
  
The four plays to be studied vary from year to year. They will be announced in class at the beginning of each semester after orientation in the first week. The text to be used is Stephen Greenblatt’s _The Norton Shakespeare, Based on the Oxford Edition_ (NY: Norton, 2008).  
  
  
1\. Regular attendance is demanded. Every absence will result in three points being deducted from the final grade average.  
  
2\. Students of this course are expected to hand in their midterm and final papers with citations in MLA format.  
  
Some basic reading materials:  
1\. Bentley, Gerald Eades, ed. _The Seventeenth-Century Stage_. Chicago and London: U of Chicago P, 1968.  
2\. Biggs, Murray, et al., eds. _The Arts of Performance in Elizabethan and Early Stuart Drama_. Edinburgh: Edinburgh UP, 1991.  
3\. Greenblatt, Stephen, ed. _The Norton Shakespeare, Based on the Oxford Edition_. NY and London: Norton, 2008.  
4\. Gurr, Andrew. _The Shakespearean Stage_, 1574-1642. 3rd ed. Cambridge: Cambridge UP, 1992.  
5\. Hinman, Charlton, ed. _The First Folio of Shakespeare_. NY: Norton, 1968.  
6\. Norman, Marc, and Tom Stoppard. _Shakespeare in Love: A Screenplay_. NY: Hyperion, 1998.  
7\. Wells, Stanley, and Gary Taylor, eds. _William Shakespeare: The Complete Works_. Oxford: Oxford UP, 1986.
